title: What is technology in education? - Quora

response.answer_text: Educational technology is that the use of each physical hardware, software, and educational theoretic to facilitate learning and rising performance by making, using, and managing appropriate technological processes and resources. It encompasses many domains together with learning theory, computer-based training, online learning, and wherever mobile technologies are used, m-learning. accordingly, there are many distinct aspects to describing the intellectual and technical development of educational technology: Educational technology because the theory and follow of educational approaches to learning. Educational technology as technological tools and media, as an example large online courses, that assist within the communication of data, and its development and exchange. this can be typically what people are referring to once they use the term Educational technology for learning management systems (LMS), like tools for student and curriculum management, and education management information systems (EMIS). Educational technology as back-office management, like training management systems for provision and budget management, and Learning Record Store (LRS) for learning knowledge storage and analysis. Educational technology itself as an educational subject; such courses is also known as Computer Studies

Technology in education refers to the application of knowledge and skills obtained from physical sciences such as engineering, computer science, physics, among others to the design and development of technological tools that can be used in teaching, learning, research, planning and administration, counseling and any other educational purposes. On the other hand, technology in education is an application of any designed or developed gadgets, resources, hardware, software and network. Thus, technology in education is sometimes referred to as “hardware approach” due to the integration of hardware and other similar gadgets in educational process.
